comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
It was Saturday, 4 August 1928 (am), and in George Street, Sydney (the newspaper could be wrong?). From the SMH of 03/08/1928 p.14 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16483960 .
" NAVY LEAGUE SEA SCOUTS More than 200 Navy League sea cadets will be the guests of the directors of Hoyt's Theatre de Luxe tomorrow morning at a screening of "The Life of Nelson." Led by Birchgrove Band the cadets will march from West Circular Quay to the theatre in George-street. "

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Aha! The cadets could not have marched from Circular Quay to NORTH Sydney - the Harbour Bridge was not yet built !

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: "Nelson" (1926) - www.imdb.com/title/tt0017199/ The SMH (06/08/1928) film critic panned it ! - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16484519

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Thank you beachcomberaustralia, our original cataloguing was wrong and this is indeed George Street, Sydney
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] Ahem! - date was 4 August. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hpeters] LOS - Laughing Out Silently! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] You shouldn't encourage me ...
The Navy Cadets make a splash By George Street they cut quite a dash. They'll be fine additions To Nelson's traditions Of Rum, Sodomy, and [gasp!], the Lash !

comment._content: Did you notice the "Honoring" despite the film being British, not American?
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] I wonder why the "or" spelling - something I never knew before is that the "our/or" spellings are the result of the 1066 Norman Conquest ! - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_and_British_English_spelli...
